001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.viewmodel;
002
003
004import android.content.Context;
005import android.hardware.Sensor;
006import android.hardware.SensorManager;
007import android.hardware.TriggerEvent;
008import android.hardware.TriggerEventListener;
009import android.util.Log;
010import androidx.lifecycle.LiveData;
011import androidx.lifecycle.MutableLiveData;
012import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModel;
013import dagger.hilt.android.lifecycle.HiltViewModel;
014import dagger.hilt.android.qualifiers.ApplicationContext;
015import java.time.Instant;
016import javax.inject.Inject;
017
018/**
019 * Provides access for the UI to get motion information.  In this case, the trigger event
020 * is just an event and no sensor data is sent/
021 */
022@HiltViewModel
023public class MotionViewModel extends ViewModel{
024
025  private final MutableLiveData<TriggerEvent> triggerEvent;
026  private final MotionTriggerListener listener;
027
028  /**
029   * Provides the context for the sensor package
030   * @param context
031   */
032  @Inject
033  public MotionViewModel(@ApplicationContext Context context) {
034    listener = new MotionTriggerListener(context);
035    triggerEvent = new MutableLiveData<>();
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * This is the interface for the UI to find motion events
040   * @return
041   */
042  public LiveData<TriggerEvent> getTriggerEvent() {
043    return triggerEvent;
044  }
045
046  class MotionTriggerListener extends TriggerEventListener{
047
048    private final SensorManager sensorManager;
049    private final Sensor sensor;
050
051    /**
052     * THis initializes the sensor package by getting a sensor service and setting is to
053     * detect motion
054     * @param context
055     */
056    public MotionTriggerListener(Context context) {
057      sensorManager= (SensorManager) context.getSystemService(Context.SENSOR_SERVICE);
058      sensor= sensorManager.getDefaultSensor(Sensor.TYPE_MOTION_DETECT);
059      sensorManager.requestTriggerSensor(this, sensor);
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * This sends the trigger event back to the UI
064     * @param event The details of the event.
065     */
066    @Override
067    public void onTrigger(TriggerEvent event) {
068      event.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
069      MotionViewModel.this.triggerEvent.postValue(event);
070    }
071  }
072
073}
